intro: Scutellaria verna, commonly known as early blueviolet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces violet-blue flowers with a distinctive dark purple spot on the lower lip, which is characteristic of the Scutellaria genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Scutellaria verna is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
